_description: Virtual Power Plant (VPP) registry. Each entry represents a VPP program that residential customers can enroll in to earn rewards for reducing energy usage during grid events. Managed independently from the integration code.

vpps.name: OhmConnect
vpps.description: Earn rewards for reducing energy during OhmHours â€” peak demand events signaled by the grid.

reward.description: Points redeemable for cash or gift cards; varies by event and savings achieved

vpps.name: Tesla Virtual Power Plant
vpps.description: Powerwall owners export stored solar energy to the grid during peak demand in exchange for credits.

reward.description: Up to $2/kWh exported during grid events (varies by utility and event)

vpps.name: Nest Renew
vpps.description: Shifts thermostat energy usage to times when the grid has more clean energy or lower demand.

reward.description: Free tier shifts to cleaner energy; Premium ($10/mo) matches usage with renewable credits

vpps.name: Enphase Energy VPP
vpps.description: Enphase battery owners can participate in grid services programs through their local utility.

reward.description: Varies by utility program; typically $0.50-$2.00/kWh during events

vpps.name: sonnenCommunity / sonnenVPP
vpps.description: Sonnen battery owners share stored energy with the community and grid during peak demand.

reward.description: Varies by program; some utilities offer monthly bill credits

vpps.name: Sunrun VPP / Shift
vpps.description: Sunrun solar+battery customers can participate in grid services to earn credits on their energy bill.

reward.description: Up to $750/year in bill credits for participating in grid events

vpps.name: Generac Concerto
vpps.description: Generac PWRcell and PWRview owners can participate in grid services through connected utilities.

reward.description: Bill credits vary by utility and event participation

vpps.name: Enel X Demand Response
vpps.description: Residential and commercial customers reduce load during demand response events for compensation.

reward.description: Compensation varies by market; typically $0.10-$1.00/kWh reduced

vpps.name: Virtual Peaker BYOD Programs
vpps.description: Bring-your-own-device programs run by local utilities through the Virtual Peaker platform. Supports thermostats, water heaters, EV chargers, and batteries.

reward.description: Varies by utility; typically $25-$200/year bill credit per enrolled device

vpps.name: Swell Energy VPP
vpps.description: Home battery aggregation for grid services in California and other markets.

reward.description: Varies by program and utility; typically covers battery lease costs
